meaningMnemonic: A <radical>spoon</radical> to measure a <radical>geoduck</radical> is a very <kanji>approximate</kanji> measurement. Geoducks are big, spoons are small. Still, we'll get the approximation going, right?
readingMnemonic: Maybe this is too much geoduck, even if we're going for an <kanji>approximate</kanji>. So, you take the <reading>core</reading> (ころ) of the geoduck and measure that instead.
